message: @zenbat why? if it's not staying on top, people are probably not really intereseted anymore. So why have a feature that annoys people?

@adsworth needless to say, I disagree.. on a busy board a good message can quickly get buried, a valid idea may not be recognised right away - anyway, bumping has been around forever and is probably here to stay. 

And while one can easily reanimate a thread by adding some new content, my point is that an OP might not want to change anything about her original message, just call new attention to an idea whose time may have come...

Well, I posted it on the API group, not on Feedback, so I guess I was thinking of implementing it in my own app. I am thinking about replacing the traditional, albeit crass, "bump" with a more attractive method.

In real life people don't pay much attention to history, on the web even less - the new usually wins out. Short attention spans and all that. 

The project I am working on makes use of older Tweets to restart conversations, and it's a trick to dig them up. We might also use Convore. You know the expression, "old is gold"..

@zenbat a bump message button would quickly get abused and the beauty of this kind of forum is that it keeps history so you can always read messages that get buried so i think a bump message button would be a disaster

I don't think this is such a bad idea. It's alot cleaner then the additional messages being added just saying [bump] and such. Also this prevents duplicate topics to a certain degree. But I do think the button should only be available after a certain period of time withouth activity, to prevent abuse.
